fingering.name: Standard
fingering.comment: Using the Bb Thumb Key. Use in passages without B-naturals

fingering.name: Alternate
fingering.comment: When Bb Thumb can't be used

fingering.name: Trill
fingering.comment: For trills or passing passages using B-natural

fingering.name: Alternate
fingering.comment: When Bb Thumb can't be used

fingering.name: Trill
fingering.comment: For trills or passing passages using B-natural

fingering.name: Alt4
fingering.comment: Good response. Useful in Prokoviev Sonata, 1st Mvt

fingering.name: Alt5
fingering.comment: Easy to finger, harder response than when foot keys are also depressed

fingering.name: Alt4
fingering.comment: Difficult to finger on open-hole models

fingering.name: Alt5
fingering.comment: Awkward but in tune. Press both the rim of F key nd the D trill key with RH 1

fingering.name: Alt12
fingering.comment: Sharp, requires very fast air stream

fingering.name: Absurd
fingering.comment: Requires closed C# cup (e.g. with knee)

fingering.name: Kicker
fingering.comment: Requires kicker. Pull back with RH Thumb and trill the tone hole.

fingering.name: Absurd
fingering.comment: Close C# cup, e.g. with knee

fingering.name: Alt-BbF
fingering.comment: Flat Interval. Without Bb Thumb or F

fingering.name: Standard
fingering.comment: Basic. Can slightly close LH1 to improve tone

fingering.name: Standard
fingering.comment: Basic. Can slightly close LH1 to improve tone.

fingering.name: Alt-BbF
fingering.comment: Flat Interval. Without Bb Thumb or F

fingering.name: BestBFoot
fingering.comment: In tune. Best on B-Foot flutes

fingering.name: C#Trill
fingering.comment: Basic for flutes with C# Trill

fingering.name: Alt3
fingering.comment: Sharp. Good response for ff. A little awkward

fingering.name: Picc
fingering.comment: Interval more in tune. Good for Piccolo

fingering.name: Alt3
fingering.comment: Awkward but more in tune B

fingering.name: Alt5
fingering.comment: Flat B. Vent RH2 as needed
